name: Comfort Inn Downtown

reviews.text: We booked a king with a city view and ended up with a nice corner view on a high floor that faced the Pyramid and a bit of the river. The room was really large with a very comfortable bed, lots of floor space, walk-in closet area and a fridge. The AAA rate, booked through the hotel was $108 each weekend night but this included breakfast. Breakfast was awesome - biscuits and gravy, waffles, and boiled eggs, along with the usual continental breakfast fare. Attendants kept it well-stocked and clean, even though there was a high school band staying there one day (and teens can eat!!). Parking is $6 daily in a lot under the hotel. Just a couple blocks from the trolley, but you can walk downtown (though even on Saturday night it was a bit isolated, which made me nervous). Pool and roofdeck on 8th floor with great view would be great in summer!
reviews.title: Good Value and Very Clean

reviews.text: Mother and 13-year-old daughter stayed 3 days at end of March. Used our car less than half the time. DO stay downtown so you can walk or take the trolley to most major attractions. Great zoo ( Giant Panda stole my heart), Graceland is very well run (get the platinum ticket that inclueds his cars and customized planes). National Civil Rights Museum, Sun Studio (a great tour), a ride in a Cinderella carriage, and a Mojo Music Bus Tour were also on our agenda, along with sampling soul food at Fourway and ribs at Rendezvous. I would do all of them again. We are not blues fans, and knew very little of the music or musicians Memphis is famous for, but this was a great orientation. Food here is reasonably-priced and it's a very casual city.
reviews.title: there's plenty to do!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed at Comfort Inn. Great breakfast, clean, $6 daily parking, clean rooms, good price.
reviews.title: Perfect location to take advantage of the famous Memphis nightlife

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: TIP: there are panhandlers downtown, but not threatening. Just put a couple of singles in your pocket so you don't have to open your purse on the street.
reviews.title: Great for the rate!

reviews.text: TIP: kids are allowed in the blues bars that don't allow smoking.
reviews.title: Bed Bugs!!!!!

reviews.text: My daughter and I finally made our first Elvis trek and chose the Comfort Inn Downtown Memphis for our 4-night stay. We are DELIGHTED we chose this hotel! The staff is courteous, friendly, and helpful. Our room was clean with ample space (2 double beds.) We chose not to rent a car and were extremely happy with that decision. Parking is a problem and many, many attractions are within walking distance. When walking is not for you, the free shuttle is closeby as are the trolley cars for only $1 per ride or multiple day passes for a few more dollars. The breakfast provided by the hotel is not your ordinary continental breakfast! I had freshly made waffles every morning! Eggs, biscuits and gravy, juice, coffee, toast, bagels, danish pastries, cereal, and other items are also available. When we return to Memphis (and we will) we will definitely stay here again - real Southern hospitality!
reviews.title: Location, Location, Location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We managed to get a room overlooking the Mississippi, a great view. Also a shortish walk from Beale Street. Acccommodation comfortable and clean. Breakfast good. The hotel has basement parking (charged). However, the decor of the hotel is looking a little tired, and could do with refreshing. Reception staff competent, but not overly enthusiastic. Overall, good value.
reviews.title: Great Location, decor just a little tired.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Nice, good value for money hotel. Located about 10 minutes from Beale Street but far enough away to avoid the noise & bustle of downtown. When we stayed the pool was being renovated so it's worth asking for a room away from the pool whilst this is going on. Complimentary breakfast was very good.
reviews.title: Good value, good location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great hotel. Very large,clean and comfortable room. A few blocks from Beal Street.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were pleased with this hotel - it's about 1/2 mile to Beale Street and directly across from Mudd Island and the visitor's center. Unfortunately Mudd Island doesn't open til the middle of April so we missed that attraction. But we were able to walk to dinner and then Beale Street afterwards so that was a plus. The room was quite large and comfortable and had a river view but there is a charge for parking (but that seemed to be standard for the hotels we checked in Memphis). Although we were pleased with the hotel, we would probably stay at a hotel with a more central location next time.
reviews.title: Good location downtown - river view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great Clean Hotel!! The Staff was very nice and helpful.... I was afraid of being to far to walk to and from Beale Street, but we took the trolley and it worked out GREAT!!! They had elevator problems one day and they had a repair man quick and resolved the issue!!! The price was less than the hotels closer to Beale, but we are always looking for a bargain and this was a GREAT BARGAIN!!! Thanks again Comfort Inn, you made my 1st experence to Memphis a great one!
reviews.title: Great Place

reviews.text: My 11 year old daughter and I stayed here in June, we really liked it a lot! We were able to get a river view room for the price of a city view room. The river view was wonderful. We were on the 15th floor facing the river, it was a nice view! The rooms were clean and the breakfast was good, the pool was fun too! The hotel is very convenient to the trolley which you can ride to Beale St., National Civil Rights Museum, etc. Everyone was really friendly, we didn't have any problems with our stay, other than the elevators as someone else posted. Our 1st night they were fine, but the 2nd night, one was out of order, made for a long wait for the elevator sometimes, but it wasn't too much of a problem. Had a problem with the internet in our room on the first night, called the front desk, they connected me to the internet people and it was up and running in no time and worked the rest of our stay.
reviews.title: We enjoyed our stay at Comfort Inn Downtown

reviews.text: We'd stay again!
reviews.title: Great View

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very pleasantly surprised after my last visit. It had been years since I stayed there, and they have improved.
reviews.title: Great Staff!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast area was great. Waffles, eggs, various breads, fruits, etc. Nice set up. Very enjoyable.
reviews.title: Location, Value, & COMFORT!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location is good, but this place needs ALOT of work. The common areas seemed rundown and in desperate need of a scrubbing. The parking underneath the building is dark, cramped and creepy..... very low ceiling.... You really have to watch where you're walking. I almost hit my head and I'm only 5'4".
reviews.title: Needs work.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was huge, but was just ok. The bathtub had some spots that appeared to be patched with spackle or something. We were on the first floor and the sidewalk and street were directly outside our window..... Never had a room so close to traffic.... I was happy that noise wasn't a problem. It was very cold in Memphis when we were there and the tile on the bathroom floor was sooooo cold..... sort of like walking on ice cubes. We put towels down and sort of slid around on those. The breakfast was ok. We had planned to stay two nights.... but.... with the hotel such as it was, in addition to the cold weather, we stayed one night and decided to grab some bbq for lunch the next day and hit the road.
reviews.title: friendly hotel, nice pool

reviews.text: I stayed at the Comfort Inn Downtown in Memphis with my husband for two nights in July. From the hotel it's just a short walk to restaurant and bars on fabulous Beale Street. Other hotels might be closer still, but the Comfort Inn offers a lovely rooftop pool with a beautiful view of the Mississippi. Rooms are spacious, clean and quiet (ask for room with river view) , staff is friendly, efficient and helpful. Good value for money.
reviews.title: Average hotel with rude nightstaff
basic, acceptable, sort of dumpy and slightly shabby
reviews.text: I stayed here for 3 nights in early June and it's an average hotel, nothing special. Good sized rooms and decent breakfast (continental). The girl on reception the night I arrived hardly acknowledged me as she was chatting on the phone, when I tried to ask a question about the Graceland package, she told me to read the brochure! She was on duty the second night aswell and was still chatting on the phone!!! The reception staff during the day were excellant and very knowledgeable and helpful. The hotel is a few blocks from the centre and the area is very very quiet at night, but most of downtown seems to be extremely quiet (eerily so) apart from Beale Street.

I would recommend staying just one night in Memphis - a trip to Graceland (highlight of the trip for me and I'm not an Elvis fan!!!) on day one and on day two a tour of the motel (on the main street) where Martin Luther King was assassinated and a tour of Sunset Studios covers everything. There is a free bus to Graceland and Sunset Studios leaving every hour from the Rock and Roll museum (not very interesting unless you are a major rock and roll fan) on the half hour - do not pay for an organised tourbus from your hotel!
reviews.title: Great Value, Location, Breakfast and More

description: High rise w/outdoor rooftop pool, covered parking, fitness centre - Downtown.
